Description: Both the hybrid cloud solution and other cloud-based threat models identify unauthorized access as a critical threat due to misconfigured access controls.
Mitigations for data tampering during transmission are shared across various threat models, emphasizing the importance of encryption.
Similar attack patterns are observed in denial of service threats across cloud environments, particularly targeting Kubernetes applications.
Compliance requirements for data protection and privacy overlap significantly with threats identified in other models, particularly regarding data loss and backup strategies.
Aggregated risks from multiple threat models highlight systemic vulnerabilities in identity and access management across cloud environments.

Source: Repeated instances of unauthorized access threats across multiple threat models indicate a systemic issue with access controls.
Common threats related to data tampering and integrity across cloud environments highlight the need for robust encryption and integrity checks.
Denial of service threats are prevalent across cloud-native applications, necessitating strong DDoS mitigation strategies.
